communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

First and foremost, I am requesting details and records pertaining to the transference of custody via Power Of Attorney from the following individuals:

Nicole Josette Sica (dob 9/16/1970)

who has transferred her custody rights to the following party;

Maria Candida Chalico (dob 01/02/1945)

I also request records and relevant documents attached to potential custody disputes, child welfare investigations, medical records, dental records, medication records, education records, mental health evaluations and any time spent being a ward of the state and subsequent closure of the case in regards to the following individuals:

Maya Rose Chalico (dob 03/22/2003)
Gabriella Nicole Chalico (dob 07/18/2001)
Francisco José Chalico (dob 08/10/2007)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alena Wile

title: Survey of New Jersey Open Records Act Resources (Office of the City Clerk)

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Survey of New Jersey Open Records Act Resources (Office of the City Clerk)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of any budget, accounting, or other records sufficient to show the expenses or resources necessary for the city (including any departments thereof) to respond to public records requests.

2. A copy of the job description for any person (whether employed by the city or any departments thereof) whose primary responsibilities include responding to or managing public records requests. If a separate record identifies the anticipated or actual amount of time the person spends on their duties (i.e., identifying how much of their time is spent on a given subject), please provide that record, as well.

3. Any record sufficient to show the salary of any person (whether employed by the city or any departments thereof) whose primary responsibilities include responding to or managing public records requests.

4. If the city maintains a log of public records requests, please provide a copy of the log dating back to January 1, 2022.

Requests 1-3 are limited to documents generated during or concerning the last fiscal year.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Open Public Records Act :: E001717-041624
communications.communication:
Dear Adam Steinbaugh: 
 
Thank you for your interest in open public records of Jersey City OPRA Center.  This will serve to acknowledge receipt of your Open Public Records Act (OPRA) request.  Your request was received in this office on 4/16/2024.  Kindly refer to the reference number E001717-041624 when communicating with our office in this regard.  Your request mentioned: 
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of any budget, accounting, or other records sufficient to show the expenses or resources necessary for the city (including any departments thereof) to respond to public records requests.

2. A copy of the job description for any person (whether employed by the city or any departments thereof) whose primary responsibilities include responding to or managing public records requests. If a separate record identifies the anticipated or actual amount of time the person spends on their duties (i.e., identifying how much of their time is spent on a given subject), please provide that record, as well.

3. Any record sufficient to show the salary of any person (whether employed by the city or any departments thereof) whose primary responsibilities include responding to or managing public records requests.

4. If the city maintains a log of public records requests, please provide a copy of the log dating back to January 1, 2022.

Requests 1-3 are limited to documents generated during or concerning the last fiscal year.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question.  PLEASE NOTE: The State Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can track and monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Jersey City OPRA Center. 
Jersey City, NJ

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Adam Steinbaugh, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Jersey City OPRA Center. Below you will find your login and password information. Please log in to the Open Public Records Center to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your requests. (https://jerseycity.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/supporthome.aspx) 
 Login: 162125-74930183@requests.muckrock.com 
 
 
 Password: Update Password (https://jerseycity.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/ForgotPassword.aspx) 
 
 If you are a first time user and did not submit your request through the open public records portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can access, track and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 Thank You, 
 
Custodian of Records 
Jersey City, NJ
